required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate a Potassium Normalization Treatment Regimen Including Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate (ZS) Among Patients With S-K ≥5.8
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate a Potassium Normalization Treatment Regimen Including Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate (ENERGIZE)

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to determine if ZS 10g administered up to three times over 10h added to insulin and glucose in patients presenting with hyperkalemia will prove tolerable and efficacious. Patients will receive ZS or Placebo on top of standard of care treatment with insulin and glucose.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Absolute Change in S-K From Baseline Until 4h After Start of Dosing With SZC/Placebo
primary_outcome.description: The least squares means (LS-means) are derived from a linear regression model of absolute change in S-K at 4h with the following covariates: treatment group; baseline S-K; time from the start of dosing insulin to the start of dosing SZC/placebo and the dose (units/kg) of the first course of insulin. The 95% CI is associated with LS-Means.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fraction of Patients Responding to Therapy Defined as: S-K <6.0mmol/L Between 1 and 4h and S-K <5.0mmol/L at 4h; and no Additional Potassium Lowering Therapy From 0 to 4h With Exception of the Initial Insulin Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Additional therapies for hyperkalaemia are 2nd dose of insulin, Beta-agonists, Diuretics, Dialysis, Sodium bicarbonate and Potassium binders when administered with the expressed intent to lower S-K. Patients with any missing potassium value from 1h to 4h inclusive will be treated as non-responders.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Fraction of Patients Achieving Normokalaemia 1, 2 and 4h After Start of Dosing With SZC/Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients achieving normokalaemia, S-K 3.5-5.0 mmol/L, at 1, 2 and 4h after start of dosing

secondary_outcome.measure: The Fraction of Patients Achieving S-K <5.5mmol/l 1, 2, and 4h After Start of Dosing With SZC/Placebo
The Fraction of Patients Achieving S-K <6.0mmol/l 1, 2, and 4h After Start of Dosing With SZC/Placebo
The Fraction of Patients Administered Additional Potassium Lowering Therapy Due to Hyperkalaemia From 0 to 4h.
secondary_outcome.description: Additional therapies for hyperkalaemia are 2nd dose of insulin, Beta-agonists, Diuretics, Dialysis, Sodium bicarbonate and Potassium binders when administered with the expressed intent to lower S-K.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Absolute Change in S-K From Baseline to 1h and 2h After Start of Dosing With SZC/Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: The least squares means (LS-means) are derived from a linear regression model of absolute change in S-K at 1h and 2h with the following covariates: treatment group; baseline S-K; time from the start of dosing insulin to the start of dosing SZC/placebo and the dose (units/kg) of the first course of insulin. The 95% CI is associated with LS-Means.

arm_group.description: ZS will be administered in addition to insulin and glucose. Insulin and glucose is the current standard of care to treat serum potassium ≥5.8mmol/L.
Placebo will be administered in addition to insulin and glucose. Insulin and glucose is the current standard of care to treat serum potassium ≥5.8mmol/L.

intervention.description: Suspension administered orally for a treatment period of 24h. 2 sachets administered up to three times over 10h (at 0, 4 and 10h).
Suspension administered orally for a treatment period of 24h. Single dose contains 2 sachets of ZS 5g. 10g administered up to three times over 10h (at 0, 4 and 10h).
Insulin 0.1 units/kg administered as a bolus or for up to 30 minutes.
Glucose 25g administered IV <15 minutes before the insulin.
Insulin 0.1 units/kg administered as a bolus or for up to 30 minutes.
Glucose 25g administered IV <15 minutes before the insulin.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
≥ 18 years of age
Potassium ≥5.8 mmol/L
Exclusion Criteria:
Possible pseudohyperkalaemia
Hyperkalaemia caused by any condition for which a therapy directed against the underlying cause of hyperkalaemia would be a better treatment option than treatment with insulin and glucose.
Dialysis session expected within 4h after randomization
Treated with any therapy intended to lower S-K between arriving at the hospital and randomization during Visit 1.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants took part in the study in the United States, Russia, Denmark and Italy from 13 February 2018 to 21 December 2018.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients with S-K ≥5.8 mmol/L for whom treatment with insulin and glucose to manage hyperkalaemia has been determined medically appropriate by the Investigator. The study originally recruited patients with S-K ≥6.0 mmol/L; however, this inclusion criterion was updated during CSP Amendment to allow enrolment of patients with S-K ≥5.8 mmol/L.

outcome.population: Full analysis set: all randomized patients. However, patients with no baseline or/and post-baseline data (one patient in each group) were excluded from the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs, including SAEs, were collected from time of signature of informed consent form throughout the treatment period and including the follow-up period (visit 2 or last contact). AE/SAEs occurring between 0h to 24h and AE/SAEs occurring after 24h (time calculated from the start of the administration of insulin) were analysed separately.
reported_events.desc: Patients at risk are the ones who got at least one dose, namely 29 in SZC and 33 in placebo.

group.title: Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate (SZC) 10g (0-24h)
group.description: SZC will be administered in addition to insulin and glucose. AEs collected between 0-24h.

group.title: Placebo (0-24h)
group.description: Placebo will be administered in addition to insulin and glucose. AEs collected between 0-24h.

group.title: Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate (SZC) 10g (After 24h)
group.description: SZC will be administered in addition to insulin and glucose. AEs collected after 24h.

group.title: Placebo (After 24 h)
group.description: Placebo will be administered in addition to insulin and glucose. AEs collected after 24h.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Recruitment was stopped at 70 patients randomized instead of 132, as initially planned.
